title.narrative: Creating Resilience through Integrated Multi-Sectoral Approach in Emergency Prone Areas of Wolayita

description.narrative:
IMC is supporting nutrition activities through the following: - Providing nutrition refresher training for health workers - Health education for 2061 caregivers on family planning, nutrition, food preparation, and RUTF use, and malaria prevention. -373 sessions on complimentary feeding demonstrations at health posts and 69 villages. -Distributing IEC materials to 55 health posts and 12 health centers. -Conducting a gap assessment in 6 schools and equipping them with mini-media materials for positive messaging. Seventeen schools organized drama shows on hygeine, family planning, and malaria. -Broadcasting radio messages two times a week. - Involving households with mild and malnourished children in a food diversification and home garden program. Nineteen HEWS and four health promoters were trained on PD/hearth.
IMC is supporting the following health activities: - Training health and community workers on communicable and infectious diseases, types of vaccine preventable diseases, and maintenance of vaccines, and family planning. -Sending 13 health centers and 27 health posts health management information system materials. -Spraying households with Indoor Residual Spray (IRS) for malaria prevention.
IMC is supporting the following WASH activities: - Constructing and rehabilitating water schemes within the community through sex segregated latrines, placenta pits, low cost incinerators and strengthening of water use associations. - Hygiene and sanitation promotion through IEC materials
IMC is suppprting the following food security activities: -Identifying vulnerable and food insecure households particularly female headed households and those with children -Distributing seeds, livestock, and poultry as means of livelihood for vulnerable families - Strengthening Rural Savings and Credit Coops -Providing support for veterinary centers

IMC is working on building the resilience of vulnerable households in the Wolayita Zone by focusing on a multi-sectoral program that includes nutrition, health, WASH and Livelihood interventions. The project focuses on enabling the community to handle the impact of drought and increase their readiness for future shocks.
